author: @zazoomblog
title: Il 2024 l' anno più caldo della storia
text:
Il 2024 l' anno più caldo della storia Agi.it | 10 gen 2025 AGI - Il 2024 è stato confermato dal Servizio per il Cambiamento Climatico di Copernicus (Copernicus Climate Change Service - C3S) come l' anno più caldo mai registrato a livello globale e il primo anno solare in cui la temperatura media globale ha superato di 1.5 C il livello preindustriale. Il C3S è implementato per conto della Commissione europea dal Centro europeo per le previsioni meteorologiche a medio raggio (ECMWF), i cui scienziati h anno monitorato i principali indicatori climatici e documentato record di temperatura giornalieri, mensili e annuali senza precedenti per il 2024 . Carlo Buontempo, direttore del Copernicus Climate Change Service, ECMWF, ha commentato: "Tutti i dati sulla temperatura globale prodotti a livello internazionale mostrano che il 2024 è stato l' anno più caldo dall'inizio delle registrazioni nel 1850. Leggi su Agi.it Il 2024 è il terzo anno più caldo misurato in Trentino in oltre un secolo (dopo 2022 e 2023) e tra i più piovosi: l'analisi Copernicus, il 2024 l' anno più caldo della storia Riscaldamento globale, nel 2024 superati per la prima volta gli 1,5°C Andamento meteorologico del 2024 Clima, Copernicus conferma: 2024 anno più caldo della storia, superata soglia 1,5°C - Geagency I dati parlano chiaro, il 2024 ha sancito il fallimento dell'accordo di Parigi sul clima Il 2024 l'anno più caldo della storia - AGI - Il 2024 è stato confermato dal Servizio per il Cambiamento Climatico di Copernicus (Copernicus Climate Change Service - C3S) come l'anno più caldo mai registrato a livello globale e il primo ann ... (msn.com) Copernicus, il 2024 è stato l'anno più caldo della storia - Secondo i dati del servizio meteo della Ue, Copernicus, il 2024 è stato l'anno più caldo da quando ci sono rilevazioni scientifiche, dal 1850. È stato così confermato con dati definitivi quanto aveva ... (msn.com) Il 2024 è stato il più caldo di sempre. Copernicus: «0,12 gradi sopra la media dell'anno precedente» - Il 2024 è stato l'anno più caldo da quando ci sono rilevazioni scientifiche, dal 1850. Lo ha reso noto il servizio meteo della Ue, Copernicus, confermando con dati definitivi ... (msn.com) Calcio a 5, Serie C1: riprende il campionato. author: Jason Burgos
title: Jayden Daniels reportedly may not be available when New York Giants make 1st pick in NFL Draft
text: The New York Giants have been linked to selecting 2023 Heisman Trophy winner Jayden Daniels when they make their first selection in April’s NFL Draft, however, a new report claims he may not be available when they are on the clock. This has been a very disappointing season for the Giants, especially on offense. Pro Bowler Saquon Barkley has had a disappointing season, the offensive line has been a mess, and injuries to their top two quarterbacks led to undrafted rookie Tommy DeVito making several starts this season. Related: Former New York Giants Super Bowl winner arrested for alleged string of robberies However, even before the injuries, some major concerns arose that Daniel Jones probably wouldn’t be the long-term answer at quarterback. Despite giving the former first-round pick a four-year contract worth $160 million earlier this year. That is why some around the league and team believe they could use their first pick in the 2024 NFL Draft on one of the talented QB prospects available. The top three signal callers in this year’s class are 2022 Heisman Trophy winner Caleb Williams, North Carolina star Drake Maye, and 2023 Heisman winner Jayden Daniels. Some believe Daniels could be New York’s top target when they are likely on the clock at five. However, a new report suggests that the LSU star could be gone before then. New York Giants potential top pick Jayden Daniels may now go after Caleb Williams Earlier this week, Sports Illustrated NFL insider Albert Breer spoke with executives and scouts around the league if Daniels is still the third-best QB available, which has been the shared assumption for months. However, some around the NFL believe Daniels has blown by Maye into the No. 2 spot. “Jayden is pulling away from Drake for me,” one AFC exec told Breer. “… He makes every throw, his deep accuracy is rare, he’s explosive as a runner but is a pocket passer. It’s like [Deshaun Watson].” Related: Potential top pick for New York Giants and New York Jets in NFL Draft declares for 2024 event While there are certainly big fans of Daniels around the league, there are also some who feel Maye is still sure to go after Williams in April. “I think Drake has a Pro Bowl ceiling,” and AFC scout told Breer. “His floor is Dak [Prescott}, before this MVP month] and his ceiling is [[Justin] Herbert]https://sportsnaut.com/player/justin-herbert/. I had Jayden as a quality backup with the ceiling of a system starter, more in-line with the [Jimmy [Garoppolo]]https://sportsnaut.com/player/jimmy-garoppolo/ or Kirk Cousins range. … I like him, his athleticism adds value. I just didn’t love him as a passer.” The New England Patriots and Washington Commanders select before the New York Giants and are likely to take a QB.

title: HSBC fired investment bankers on bonus day, didn't pay bonuses: report | Seeking Alpha
text:

author: CBS San Francisco
title: Rain, gusty winds hitting Bay Area; high surf to continue to batter coast - CBS San Francisco
text:
The National Weather Service forecast for the greater San Francisco Bay Area for Friday calls for up to 100 percent chance of rain throughout the day, with gusty winds expected in most areas of the region which may cause downed tree limbs and power outages.
A Wind Advisory was in effect Friday from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m., with widespread strong southerly winds and gusts generally to 20-30 mph, up to 40-50 mph along the coast and at ridgetops, the weather service said.
In addition, a High Surf Advisory was in effect until 6 p.m., while a Coastal Flood Advisory was in effect until 2 p.m. Thursday's High Surf Warning has expired.
KPIX First Alert Weather: Current conditions, alerts, maps for your area
Forecasters say the high surf will continue to batter the coast ahead of the next system, causing some coastal flooding issues. The next system will impact the region on Friday and Saturday, bringing gusty winds and periods of moderate to heavy rains.
According to the NWS, there is also a slight chance of thunderstorms in the region, mainly Friday night and Saturday. Another round of high surf is expected to impact the region on Saturday, with more coastal flooding possible.
Daytime highs will be in the 60s throughout the Bay Area. Overnight lows should be mostly in the 50s in the region, with some areas dropping into the upper 40s.
Unsettled weather is expected to continue as a series of storms aim at the California Coast. The next more significant storm may impact the region midweek, according to forecasters.

organizations.name: cbs san francisco the national weather service

author: MENAFN
title: Israeli Occupation Attacks Worshipers, Prevents Access To Al-Aqsa Mosque | MENAFN.COM
text:
( MENAFN - Jordan News Agency)
Occupied Jerusalem, Feb. 23 (Petra)-- Israeli occupation forces, on Friday, attacked worshipers in the vicinity of Lions Gate, one of the gates leading to Al-Aqsa Mosque, in the occupied city of Jerusalem.
They were also stopped from entering the mosque to perform prayers, as well as in the nearby neighborhood of Wadi Al-Joz, and a Jerusalemite child was taken into custody.
Eyewitnesses told the Jordan News Agency (Petra)'s correspondent that in addition to setting up military checkpoints and stopping and searching Jerusalemites in order to keep them from entering the Old City and the Al-Aqsa Mosque, the occupation soldiers also attacked many of them.
